Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.28630199] Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 29213)(MIC>128 μg/ml); B. cereus ATCC 10876 (MIC=46 μg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=2 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=3 μg/ml), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC=1.5 μg/ml)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.28630199]1.4 ± 0.4% hemolysis at 8 μg/ml, 5.1 ± 0.5%  hemolysis at 16 μg/ml, 7.3 ± 0.6%  hemolysis at 32 μg/ml, 12.2 ± 0.7% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against chicken red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against the Gram-negative bacteria and Gram-positive bacteria.

Literature.Title: Genomewide Analysis of the Antimicrobial Peptides in Python bivittatus and Characterization of Cathelicidins with Potent Antimicrobial Activity and Low Cytotoxicity
Literature.Reference: Antimicrob Agents Chemother. 2017 Aug 24;61(9). pii e00530-17.
Literature.Author: Kim D, Soundrarajan N, Lee J, Cho HS, Choi M, Cha SY, Ahn B, Jeon H, Le MT, Song H, Kim JH, Park C.

Literature.Title: The Mechanism of Killing by the Proline-Rich Peptide Bac7(1-35) against Clinical Strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa Differs from That against Other Gram-negative Bacteria
Literature.Author: Runti G, Benincasa M, Giuffrida G, Devescovi G, Venturi V, Gennaro R, Scocchi M
